did.unittitle: Bruce Barton, New York, New York, to George Matthew Adams, New York, New York 1925 December 28

scopecontent.p: Thanks him for the The Life of Elbert H. Gary: a story of steelby Ida M. Tarbell and mentioning his own book [ The Man Nobody Knows; a discovery of Jesus] published last spring and sending a copy.

did.unittitle: Jay N. Darling (Ding) to George Matthew Adams, New York, New York 1926 April 7

scopecontent.p: Expresses gratitude at his word of encouragement.

did.unittitle: E. C. P., Warner-Patterson Company, Chicago, Illinois, to George Matthew Adams, New York, New York 1926 April 8

scopecontent.p: Discusses her stay in Winter Haven and inquiring as to his decision about starting a newspaper there, and praising his "Today's Talk" entitled "Son-To-Be."

did.unittitle: Bruce Barton, Barton, Durstine & Osborn, Inc., New York, New York, to George Matthew Adams, New York, New York 1927 December 28

scopecontent.p: Expresses appreciation at Adams making his book, [ What Can A Man Believe], into an editorial.

did.unittitle: "Today's Talk" by George Matthew Adams entitled "Jesus, My Friend" 1926

scopecontent.p: About Bruce Barton and his book [ The Book Nobody Knows].

did.unittitle: "Today's Talk" by George Matthew Adams entitled "What Has Become of My Life" 1927 December 27

scopecontent.p: About Bruce Barton and his book [ What Can A Man Believe].
